text: Thanks Nathan! I imagine it's not #1 priority as there are other ways to enrol objects into workflows by just changing properties that are the enrolment triggers for certain workflows - but would be great to see this expanded to make it easier! :slightly_smiling_face:

Hello Folks!

I'm wondering how to know if my user's inbox isn't connected from the API to avoid the error below.
`has no connected inboxes`

Context: I'm trying to enroll a contact in a sequence, but first, the user needs to connect their HS with their email provider.
cc <@U07L37N4F9U>

Hi Victor,
The sequences team can give the official answer on if there's a way to do this, but I took a quick look in their code and the only place they validate the user has a connected inbox is within the creation function that returns this error, so I would assume there is no API call to pre-check this.

<@U05E77XEY4V> can you link the Sequences team here? I can't find who the PM is or who I'm supposed to link here and from previous posts, you seem to know :)

Hi team! I'm looking for a HubSpot API expert in this automation V4 to help me to create some scripts in JS to create workflows. I'm always having issues :sweat_smile: , I want someone that it is an expert and it is available to work in the upcoming days. Is someone available?

Hi Victor, I recommend reaching out to Blair over email as he’s not in the HubSpot Dev Community yet. Also please note that this channel is specifically for the Workflows API :slightly_smiling_face:  I’ll rename for clarity.
